definition: cheap/inexpensive/small advantages/to let sb off lightly
plain/informal/suitable/convenient/opportune/to urinate or defecate/equivalent to 就[jiu4]: then/in that case/even if/soon afterwards
advantageous/favorable/to benefit at others' expense/to take unfair advantage
act at one's discretion/act as one sees fit
to look for a bargain/to seek advantage/to try to gain at expense of others
to have benefited from sth but pretend otherwise/to claim to be hard done by, even though one has benefited

sentences.english: It's much cheaper to anticipate rather than respond.
sentences.chinese: 因为预先做出反应远比事后补救便宜的多。

sentences.english: The tools of media will become more easy to use and more affordable.
sentences.chinese: 媒体工具会变得更加容易操作，更加便宜。

sentences.english: Wife, is not good-looking, but net, delicious cheap.
sentences.chinese: 老婆，是刀鱼，不好看，但好吃便宜啊。

sentences.english: I finally reach Leifeng, the entry fee a bargain 40 yuan.
sentences.chinese: 最后我来到雷锋塔，门票很便宜，只要40元。

sentences.english: She fritters away all her money on cheap clothes.
sentences.chinese: 她老是买便宜的衣服，把钱都浪费了。

sentences.english: The equipment shall be small, cheap, simple and transportable.
sentences.chinese: 设备应小，便宜，简单，可移动。

sentences.english: They're cheap, a few bucks at the most.
sentences.chinese: 蒸笼很便宜，最多几美元。

sentences.english: Also the limited-time offers, which make you feel like you have to take advantage of a special deal.
sentences.chinese: 也要当心限时优惠，这会让你感到占了便宜。

sentences.english: Though brutally mistreated, slaves were not cheap.
sentences.chinese: 虽然遭受残酷虐待，黑奴并不便宜。

sentences.english: Your code can guide you to fixes that are cheap and light.
sentences.chinese: 代码可以引导你找到那些又便宜又轻便的修正方法。

sentences.english: In turn, the cheaper lighting has led to higher overall energy use.
sentences.chinese: 反过来，更便宜的照明灯导致了使用能源总量的上升。

sentences.english: It's cheaper than to bring the partners here.
sentences.chinese: 这比带陪练过来要便宜得多。

sentences.english: He frequents the commission sale store, hoping to fish out some bargain basement goods.
sentences.chinese: 他常光顾寄售商店，想捞点便宜货。

sentences.english: The Spurs might have found another steal in the draft.
sentences.chinese: 马刺很有可能又一次在选修环节中捡了一个大便宜。

sentences.english: A home-made typewriter costs less than an imported one maybe.
sentences.chinese: 我们国产打字机可能要比进口的便宜。

definition: to calculate/to weigh (pros and cons)/to view as profitable/worthwhile/value for money/cost-effective
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
worthwhile/to be a good deal/to be a bargain/to reckon up/to calculate
it isn't worth it/not cost-effective/not profitable/too expensive
